channel.title: .jar problem
channel.description:
So i created a .jar of my client and when I try to run, it doesn't open! So after a bit googling i found a guy saying this:[i]copy the jar file to your desktop (just to make things simpler) then open command prompt by pressing windows key + r. Then typing in "cmd" inside the run dialog. Once in cmd type "cd desktop" then type﻿ "java -jar JAR FILE NAME.jar". it should then try and launch the jar file and tell you any errors.[/i]
When I did that my prompt telled me this: Could not find the main class: client. program will exit.
Help would be appreciated ;)

item.title: .jar problem
item.dc:creator: @Tibi_800 Tibi 800
item.description:
@Tibi_800 wrote:

So i created a .jar of my client and when I try to run, it doesn’t open!
So after a bit googling i found a guy saying this:copy the jar file to your desktop (just to make things simpler) then open command prompt by pressing windows key + r. Then typing in “cmd” inside the run dialog. Once in cmd type “cd desktop” then type﻿ “java -jar JAR FILE NAME.jar”. it should then try and launch the jar file and tell you any errors.

When I did that my prompt telled me this:
Could not find the main class: client. program will exit.

Help would be appreciated

Read full topic
